main event: An unidentified flying object (UFO) was observed in the skies near Amarade State RA 1, New Mexico, on September 20, 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as an orange red ball, larger than the largest planes the observer had seen., The sighting occurred during a rainstorm, and the observer noted an unusual change in the weather after seeing the object., The object appeared in different positions and seemed to move slowly and smoothly at all times., The observer thought the object was a possible tornado or lightning bolt at first but later understood it to be a UFO., No other witnesses at the drilling rig saw the object despite attempts to inform them about the sighting.
location: Amarade State, Chaves County, New Mexico, US
witness description: The observer was driving to a wildcat well and noted various characteristics of the sighted object.
